summary: Federal decision-makers need evidence—such as data and the results of studies—to determine if programs are working as intended and to identify potential improvements. As part of a government-wide push to improve the collection and use of evidence, agencies are required to assess their related efforts every 4 years. Of the 23 agencies we reviewed, 21 said the assessment process helped them to better understand what...
title: Evidence-Based Policymaking: Agencies Need Additional Guidance to Assess Their Capacity
